result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J Gordon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew J Gordon was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Matthew J Gordon was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

records.addlTxt: 3:10 Defendant Matthew J Gordon in court with attorney Charles David Betthauser.  Defendant Matthew J Gordon in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

10:05 Defendant Matthew J Gordon in court, in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bliss has withdrawn as counsel. Defendant is requesting new Public Defender and has contacted  them.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: cover letter from Attorney Bliss with Motion and Order to Withdraw

2:00 Defendant Amanda L Bartlett in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll, who appears by phone.  Defendant Isaac R Hanneman in court with attorney Melissa Dalkert. Defendant Pandora L. Weir appears by phone means with attorney Karl Schmidt. Attorney Robert Gardner in court on behalf of Defendant David J Zabawa. Attorney John Bliss in court on behalf of Defendant Matthew J Gordon. Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Weir has filed a motion to sever.
Attorney Lambert agrees with motion except as to Defendant Zabawa.
Attorney Schmidt concurs, but objects that Defendant Weir's case be tried with Defendant Bartlett's cases.
Attorney Carroll states that his client, Defendant Bartlett will be entering a plea before trial.
Court grants Defendant Weir's motion to sever as to Defendant Hanneman and Defendant Gordon. Her case will be tried with Defendant Zabawa and Defendant Bartlett, if Defendant Bartlett wishes to have a trial. Defendants Hanneman and Gordon will be tried alone.
Plea hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on June 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:34 Attorney John M Bliss in court.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bliss has filed a motion to modfy cash bond to signature bond and makes statement. Attorney Zell is objecting to bond being modified. 
Court modifies bond to $2500 cash bond with same conditions.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
for Bond Modification
cover letter from Attorney Bliss with Motion for Bond Modification
for the Roduction of Exculpatory Evidence

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: cover letter from Attorney Bliss with Discovery Demand

Defendant Matthew J Gordon in court with attorney John M Bliss.  Defendant Matthew J Gordon in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

9:46 Defendant Matthew J Gordon in court, in custody.  Defendant Pandora L. Weir in court with Attorney Karl Schmidt. Defendant Pandora L. Weir in custody. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions Matthew Gordon regarding his non-representation. He states he has contacted public defender, but has not heard back. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.
David Bailey is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a police officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 9/6/16, he spoke to R.N. who indicated that someone had entered his home and took firearms, knives and coins. He did not give anyone consent to take the firearms. He spoke to defendants and they admitted to taking items from the residence. Pandora had a key to the apartment and gave it to Matthew. The coins were taken to Wal-Mart. The witness identifies Defendant Pandora Weir in the courtroom. The witness identifies Defendant Matthew Gordon in courtroom. Attorney Schmidt cross-examines witness.
Attorney Lambert makes statement.
Attorney Schmidt makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and defendants committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Lambert requests cash bond for Pandora Weir be reduced. State objects.  Denied. Bond is continued for both defendants.  Arraignment scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
1:40 Defendant Matthew J Gordon in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.
Defendant Matthew J Gordon not in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant ordered.  Body only.
